content: This chair is comfortable if you are spending a long time setting on it, especially the back part it is smooth and comfortable. and high-quality material. Good quality for the price. It has up and down directions to fit all the needs. It is easy to install it takes about 20min.
author: Narouz Makar
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: comfortable office chair with back support
content: Comfortable, strong, good design, good quality and Easy to assemble. suitable office chair for sitting much time at work.
author: mohamed
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Nice professional office chair
content: Pros- the chair is really nice, great mobility, great support, and I really love that you can swivel and adjust the neck support Cons- I wish the height adjustment was longer and that it had more precise instructions on which screws go with what part
author: Diana
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Great Comfortable Light Office Chair
content: I bought this light office chair for the 'home office' of my wife for a place, where we don't have much space and it fits very nicely because the chair is quite narrow and my really loved it from the first trial. Pros: - Easy to assemble with only 4 drawings and screws in the package have easy to fit numbers - Great lumbar and flexible neck support - Extra screws for every size - Very stylish - Quite sturdy - Comfortable for the price - Doesn't need much space (quite slim design) - Easy relaxing rocking and swivelling - High adjustment very easy and precise - Chair rolls around easily. - Arm rests quite low, which I prefer Cons: - Drawings in the instructions are very small - No cushion on arm rests (but of course is as described)
author: Dan Mitchell
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Great modern chair - easy to assemble
content: This chair is so sleek and gorgeous. I’ve been needing to get a new office chair for months now. I had a leather one and the leather had started to crack badly. I wanted a chair that was really nice but didn’t have leather or faux leather so I wouldn’t have to worry about the material cracking. This chair fits the bill perfectly. It’s got really clean lines and is super sleek and chic. It looks really modern with mesh-like backing. It is super comfortable: the padding on the butt is great, the back of the chair is angled perfectly, and the head rest is tilted, which all combine for maximum comfort. It rolls very freely and has a handle that allows you to go up and down. It looks a lot more expensive than it really was. Very happy with my purchase and would buy it again.
author: Nicole O.
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Amazing office chair for the price!!
content: We’ve been stuck working from home since March and my husband was on the hunt for a decent office chair. We took a chance on this chair because it had what he wanted at a reasonable cost. The chair was super easy to put together and looks and feels amazing! He said the chair was of the quality of chairs twice its price. The mesh back is modern and breathable and very supportive. The height can be adjusted and the wheels are good quality. What can I say? It’s been about a month and my hubby still thanks me and brags about his chair. If you’re looking for a reasonably priced home office chair look no further.
author: Tracey
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Sturdy Chair with Back Support
content: I love the lumbar support this chair gives me. I'd been using a different chair and when I got this one, and put it together, which didn't take long at all, I noticed right away the difference. The chair is easy to maneuver on carpet, it gives my back a good support. I notice already the postition I sit in is better for me than how I was slumped over before. The back headrest  moves and you can adjust the height up or down. Overall, it is a good sturdy chair with good, lumbar back support, which is important when sitting for long periods of time like I do. No negatives so far.
author: Terri
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Decent Chair with good warranty.
content: I have purchased this chair for my daughter who needs a chair for couple of hours daily. After using it for a few days this is what I felt about this chair. Installation: This is easy if you use only the screws and Allen wrench. I was trying to use the washers provided by and it was not fitting exactly to the nut. once I stopped using the washers everything was falling in place. there are few extra bolts provided so do not bother about them. else installation was completed in around 15-20 minutes. The drawings of installation should have been a bit better. Comfort  & Functionality : Everything works as intended. A decent chair that could be used for 2-3 hours per day. The leather  looks to be of decent quality. I do not seen any issues with the plastic handles as some of reviewers mentioned. Conclusion :One of the reason I have purchased this is because of the warranty which is for 5 years. All in all this is a decent chair for a decent price. Only thing that they should have done is to provide a more simplified installation manual.
author: mikep777
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Awesome chair very reasonably priced.
content: Chair looks great. Easy to assemble. Priced very low. Parts were clear and labeled. Took me less than 20 minutes to assemble. Chair might even be a little under priced because it was very good quality and loved it. Would pay more than 85 for this chair for sure.  People with a home office looking for an affordable but awesome chair would love this deal. To be honest I would buy this chair without the rebate for 85 dollars. Great chair, easy assembly. Loved it. It has great lumbar support. Tilt adjust works perfectly and smothly. Love the chair.
author: Tarun Patel
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Great for home office!
content: With working from home becoming a new normal, I was meaning to get a good chair for my home office and finally got this one as this looks very similar to the one I used to use at my work. This definitely feels like very high quality chair. The cushion on the seat is very thick which makes it comfortable to sit on for longer periods of time. The back rest is made of mesh material so it doesn’t get hot as it is breathable. The height adjustment knob works as expected. Instructions to set it up could have been better but the quality of the chair makes up for it. At first the wheels felt like they won’t fit but a little push made them fit into the base. Overall satisfied with this chair!
author: ena
product: Office Chair High Back Executive Computer Desk Chair, Adjustable Tilt Angle Headrest Lumbar Support Ergonomic Swivel Chair (Mesh (Metal Base))

title: Hurts your butt
content: This may be the most uncomfortable chair I've ever sat in.  There is some sort of bump on the bottom cushion that presses on your tailbone.  Also, the cushion on the bottom flattened after about 1 day of sitting in it, making the bump even worse.  I only weigh 200 lbs, so I'm within weight limits.  The massager works, but it does not come with a power block, so you'll have to use an old iPhone charger to power it.  Even then, the cable is too short to use the massager without a USB extension cable.  In conclusion - I do not recommend this chair.  Spend more money on a better chair.
author: Joseph A Blakely
product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Worst Office Chair Ever - How do you mess up a seat?
content: I know that this chair was more of an entry-level office chair, so my expectations were not very high to begin with. I wanted to like this chair... I just thought, well it may just need a couple of weeks to "break-in".  After a couple of weeks, this chair is breaking me! The most important piece of an office chair is the seat.  How do you mess this up? The seat is made up of two parts: 1. One solid hard plastic square that you sit on.  It is not actually a full seat with support. 2. Everything else is just a very thin piece of form, just to hold the shape of the seat for presentation only. This foam is not used as support or cushion. You can see in the picture, the sunken pieces around the hard square. I would feel bad giving this chair away for free.  It is painful to sit on and I would not want anyone else to experience this pain.  Less than 30 days of ownership, I already ordered a new chair from a different manufacturer and will be throwing this one away. DO NOT BUY THIS CHAIR.
author: Nathan Perry
product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Doesn't massage; it vibrates
content: For the proce it's decent but it doesn't massage it vibrates on the lumbar and glutes only
author: DeeDee Johnson
product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Don't buy it
content: It's very very noisy when you rock it backwards and forwards the sound come from the part where the seat it .the massage it's very cheap and loud .I'm not happy I wish I kept the box so I can return it .don't buy and very expensive too it cost me 104 with taxes,the company contact me and they tried to help me I asked to replace the part where the seat attached with and they send it but I couldn't take it part because it since put together jam and can't take it out unless you have especial tool .after many trying I asked to refund my money .

product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Very uncomfortable
content: Overall I give this chair 3 stars. Although it’s a great looking chair. Really easy to assemble. It’s VERY uncomfortable due to the vibrating mechanics. There’s this hard square portion right in the seat. It’s a chair.... it should be comfortable to sit in and it’s not. I work from home and it has my entire bum sore and in pain after a full work day.... not cool... Now i have to go buy a seat cushion. Smh. Defeats the purpose
author: Kimberly
product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Comfortable chair at a reasonable price
content: While I like the chair and find it mostly comfortable, I wish it had adjustable lumbar support and the massage feature pulsated more firmly. The massage feature is probably limited by the power source (USB input), so you wouldn't compare it to a dedicated massage chair and should look at it as a novelty add on. Fortunately, the chair was priced the same as others with similar materials that didn't have the massage function. I am able to make it through a consistent WFH day without my back killing me as with the chair it replaced. I hope this was helpful!
author: Mr. Torres
product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Comfortable chair
content: Comfortable to sit in and even comes with a USB powered vibrating massage. I don't use the massager much because I don't like vibrations but it's a neat addition.

product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Overall a nice chair for the price
content: Overall the chair is great. It’s extremely comfortable and was easy to assemble[the trick is don’t tighten all the screws until all pieces are in place]. I only gave it a 4 star though because I wish the cord was longer and was not a USB.

title: Excited and then disappointed...
content: I was finally excited to receive the chair. I unboxed it love the look and feel of it right away.  Assembly  was simple. My disappointment came when I added the finishing touches, I was about to plug in the cord and to my dismay the piece that you plug (the part coming off the back of the chair) was smashed flat.  I will say that the seat cushion could stand to be softer.

product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Not the best chair for the price
content: First of all, the chair was delivered to my neighbor. I don’t think it’s the manufactory’s fault. Amazon delivery usually leaves me a photo to show success delivery. But this time no photo taken. Very weird and suspicious. My very nice neighbor has to carry this huge box over across street to my house. Fine. I was thankful but embarrassed. Then the chair comes with a very short power cord. So short didn’t even reach the floor, so I have to buy extension cord before I can use the massager. Overall, long story for this chair. If it’s not because it’s so big and heavy. I would have returned it.

product: Home Office Chair Massage Desk Chair Ergonomic Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Headrest Armrest High Back Task Chair Rolling Swivel PU Leather Executive Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Excellent chair for the price point. Very small complaints.
content: After spending many days researching chairs in the sub $200 category, I decided on this one. As you may note, this chair is extremely similar to the Lorell Executive Mesh High Back chair as well as the Alera Elusion High Back chair. Please keep in mind this is a review of a sub-$200 chair and will not be compared to the likes of $800-$1000 chairs, which seems some people like to do for some reason. I work from home at least once per week as well as many hours dedicated to browsing the internet and gaming. So I needed a chair that had a high level of comfort for long periods of time. In this price range, it pretty much came down to a lot of store brand junkers as well as the Ikea Markus (which generally gets very favorable reviews across the board). I came upon the Proline II via PC Gamer's article from 02/05/2015 as their recommendation for budget chair. Bought it and overall am pleased. Overall build construction appears to be very good. So let's do some pros/cons: Pros: - Firm, dense seat cushion that still has plenty of give. I would not describe it as "plush", but the end result is that I still don't notice it after eight hours. That is a win when I consider comfort. - Back mesh gives enough support and give. Good amount of lower and center-of-back support. - Casters are silky smooth and move with ease. - Plenty of adjustments available (seat front-to-back adjustment ,armrest height and width adjustment, seat angle adjustment, backrest angle adjustment, backrest tilt tension, and forward tilt). There aren't a ton of chairs at this pricepoint that give these adjustments. Semi-Cons: - For those needing a lot of lumbar support, I don't think this will fit the bill. I would have loved a bit more lumbar support, but I find that if I stay upright I get enough overall support. - The tilt tension seems overly low. Even at it's "tightest" tension, the chair back will still move with very little movement. I would have liked a bit more resistance. But I have the backrest locked 90% of the time anyway, so this isn't a huge problem. Cons: - Arrived with a tear/puncture on the bottom of the cushion. There was no damage to the box when it arrived, so I'm not sure what hit it. I've submitted a request to Office Star to remedy this without returning the entire product. If I'm unable to get it repaired, I'm pretty sure it will spread after use. - Arm rests are a fairly hard plastic. Comfort is still there, but be aware that these aren't super soft. Also, even after tightening the knobs to lock them in place, they still have some side-to-side movement. Again, not a dealbreaker, but it's notable. Overall I am highly pleased with this chair and am happy I spent less than $200 to snag it. I feel it is priced well for it's amount of features. As a side note, I certainly don't understand the reviewer who complained of hard-to-understand instructions. The assembly was very straight forward. The "Mechanism" they discuss is the only huge part in the entire box (the part that contains all of the adjustment levers). Yes, it's funny that the instructions do ambiguously describe it as "The Mechanism", but it's quite clear that is exactly what it is. I assembled it in less than 15 minutes without issue and I would assume most other buyers wouldn't have any issue assembling this chair. The only small quib is that yes, one of the six bolts that attach the mechanism to the chair is a bit tough to get at due to the levers. The supplied allen wrenches will reach it though and shouldn't take more than another minute to tighten down. I'd happily edit this to a five star if I'm able to sort out the fabric tear. Edit: Sent an email to the company with pictures of the tear and filled out a form requesting a new seat. Within a week of confirming the email, they had shipped me out a new seat, no charge. Boosting to five stars, excellent customer service.
author: K.A.
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Great chair until my wife snagged it from me
content: I ordered this chair be it's similar to the one I have at work. My work chair is a Hermann Miller and, though I love it, I simply don't have that kind of money lying around. When the chair arrived the outer box looked pretty rough. Thankfully the chair was well-packed and had lots of protection from the shipping company. Overall, assembly was straight-forward. The hex key/Allen wrench is kind of useless; I used a socket wrench instead. Pay mind to the instructions on moving the mechanism back when trying to reach and tighten the back bolts underneath the seat. It will make life easier. As soon as the chair was together I tried it out and adjusted it to my liking. I was duly impressed: the chair is very comfortable and supportive, with a strong breathable mesh with just the right amount of give. My wife works from home one day a week so she tried it out. Now she uses it instead of the uncomfortable chair I bought this one to replace. So now I have to get another one unfortunately. Anyhow, the chair is excellent. The feel and construction are of high quality and I look forward to maybe being able to sit in it one day again.
author: J. Scholz
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Absolutely the worse chair I've ever purchased
content: I received the box and it was huge and extremely heavy.  I thought that was a good sigh as a sturdy chair should weight a lot.  I pulled everything out of the box and put it together. As soon as I sat on it I knew it was bad. The chair sits very high.  If you're under 6ft good luck touching the floor with your feet.  I tried to adjust it to make it go lower, but no dice.  The height of the seat throws off everything else off so the hand rests were making contact with my desk regardless of what height I put it at.  I thought it was fine as I could still put my feet on the bottom supports and find a comfortable position. I think started to adjust the seat (front to back), btw the chair seats very shallow.  You can't set it any further back than what you get it as  but it will slid forward quite a bit.  I left it at the neutral position and then tried to adjust the back rest.  No matter how I set it and now matter how high or low I put the back rest it just wouldn't sit comfortably.  I pressed myself against the back rest to see if there  was any give and found that it had too much give.  I was able to feel the cross members on the back of the chair. There are multiple adjustments on the chair and all of them worked but one.  The seat tilt adjustment was just moving around loosely.  I tried every different angle and still nothing.  I just ended up giving up and tore the thing down and processed my return.  Don't buy unless you're tall and like a shallow seat with horrible adjustments.
author: Fractal32
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Seriously an awesome chair with multiple adjustments
content: This really is an awesome chair with multiple adjustments that lock in place.  I like the fact that it has a tilt adjustment that locks in place to where you want it. It has more than one tilt adjustment actually there is one in the front and one in the back there’s also a knob underneath you can twist to make the tilting harder or easier if you choose to leave the tilt unlocked. I prefer the tilt in the back that you can move the seat up or down and lock in the position. Also the seat has a knob that you pull out and you can slide the seat forward or back which is another great adjustment. The back itself has adjustments as well it leans back far.  The armrests have three adjustments as well which is awesome one adjustment allows it to go further away from the sides the second adjustment goes up or down and the third adjustment slides the top part of the pad forward or back. I also bought the headrest which fit perfectly for this chair you just pop out the two little  plastic covers that they have covering screw holes and the head rest came with the perfect screws to fit and it looked perfectly in place. The next thing I purchased separately were the wheels that were recommended they are very nice and quiet they roll a lot smoother than the regular wheels and it goes from my carpet to hardwood with no issues. I highly recommend this chair if you work all day or if you game all day it is very comfortable and adjustable you will not be disappointed.
author: Heather
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Don't bother - terrible product and support
content: Reviews were pretty good on this so I took a chance.  What a mistake.  Out of the box, it seemed like a good, heavy duty product. for the money.  Assembly instructions are unclear in a couple of key places and no attempt to reach out to the company has resulted in help.  The chair adjustment mechanisms do not work, and the chair is stuck in a tilted forward position, making it unusable.  Instructions have only a Parts number, which takes you to a message line that reads ads for other products to you and then hangs up on you if you don't click through on one of them.  I checked with the website and there is no support line...only corporate line.  They patched me through to a random voice mail. So, if the chair is unusable, it's neither a bargain, nor good quality for the price.  Keep shopping, and look for someone who says they offer back end support for their product.
author: Wanda
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: DO NOT BUY THIS CHAIR
content: I have never had such a hard time assembling a chair in my life! Screws hidden under control rods almost impossible to tighten, one picture, worthless instructions... and the controls don’t work after an hour of difficulty. Anything else would be better than this thing.
author: Not you
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Breakdowns & lots of Customer Service
content: When I wrote the following review I had just received my Proline II ProGrid High Back Managers Chair.  Circling back 2 months later.  Exhausted. Here is my UPDATED REVIEW: The chair looked good with lots of functionality.  Amazon does not guarantee a return on this product (beware of this when purchasing products like this through Amazon - and check the manufacturers return instructions before purchase to be fully apprised of what you may need to do if your expensive chair doesn't work properly). In this case, one has to contact the manufacturer, who does not sell directly and suggests you check with Amazon for a replacement.  It's a bit of a dichotomy since one does not support the other.  The company is co-operative in sending out replacement parts (no chance on a full replacement),  first the seat bottom mechanism needed replacing because the tilt lever No.2 did not work and then 2 weeks later the entire cylinder which lifts the chair failed to operate. Fortunately my husband is handy and able to replace each part as it has broken with the replacement part sent by Office Star Products, the manufacturer of this chair.  At this point I've owned the chair for 2 months of only which 2 weeks it was fully operable.  I'm hoping this is the last part replacement and wish I had ordered another model chair. At over $200. this chair should be more reliably made.  I'm disappointed and frustrated, but grateful for the companies willingness to honor their warranty...and for the ability to retrieve my invoice on Amazon.  Don't throw out those seat assembly instructions with company contact info and limited warranty when you receive this chair....you will probably need it...and will be directed to a company website to fill out a parts order form, submit it by email with your receipt and a photo of the chair problem.  A lot of fuss, twice, for what I thought would be a good office chair.  UGH! OLD REVIEW:The chair was delivered faster than the estimated delivery; always nice. Only 20 min to put together, you do need a screw driver.  One of the levers didn't operate.  Within a week I phone Proline customer service and they sent the new part out immediately and didn't require me to send back the part that wasn't functioning (even though I saved the box, just in case). I didn't do this through Amazon as a return, but called ProLine directly, from the phone number listed on the assembly instructions.  Excellent customer service. The chairs levers require a little bit of study to maneuver.  Ex.  push down on this one while pulling on that one.  The levers control seat tilt, adjustable arms, adjustable back, seat slide and chair height, give this office chair the customization of a much more expensive model.  The seat is comfy and very roomy, the back firm, the arms even adjust width and height-wise for perfect computer keyboard positioning. I find I adjust through the day for different needs; when working I keep the seat back tight to my lower back which needs support, when relaxing, I release the back and lean back and its' easy to do. The wheels are sturdy.  I spent a long time deciding which chair I wanted since I am in marketing and spend long days on the computer.  Ergonomics were important to me and this chair provides those adjustments. Not sure this would be a chair for an industrial space as it doesn't have stainless steel parts, but rather plastic/acrylic/moulded, but great for an acrylic floor chair mat over office carpeting. Will circle back in 6 months to weigh in on longevity and continued functioning.
author: VivaGreene
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Great chair, poor instructions. How to enable free-float!
content: I figured out how to rid myself of that pesky forward float it ships in and enabling free-float! For those that have been suffering with the seat resting too far forward: - lift up lever 2 (the one that locks the lower tilt) - under your seat is a downward facing knob, turn it right to loosen it. don't worry, it'll stop on its own - you'll notice the tension of the forward facing has loosened, sit on your chair - lock lever 2 and lever 3 (lower and back tilting) - lean all the way back with your hand on the first lever pushing forward. Once you've leaned back far enough, the lever will lock into position, finally losing that pesky forward facing action. It took me quite some time to figure this out. I was simply locking the bottom adjustment in place, but I didn't like the idea of having a free-float feature and it didn't make sense that a chair this fully featured wouldn't have that option. I hope this helps everyone.
author: Richard Macias
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Broken and no way to reach them
content: I received the chair and they had wrong parts so I couldn't even put it together. The numbers to reach them were nothing but ADVERTISEMENTS!  No support.  No help.  Now my only option is to go through the hassle of somehow boxing up a huge chair and HOPEFULLY seeing if I even get a chair that works.  AVOID!!!!
author: Aaronpc
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Very comfortable well made
content: Great chair, very comfortable and seems well made. Easy assembly although a THOROUGH reading of the instructions  is recommended. Note for those who complain about assembly: One of the reasons the chair is priced reasonably is that it is NOT assembled. Can't have your cake and eat it too unless you are a Democrat.

The wheels are sturdy.  I spent a long time deciding which chair I wanted since I am in marketing and spend long days on the computer.  Ergonomics were important to me and this chair provides those adjustments. Not sure this would be a chair for an industrial space as it doesn't have stainless steel parts, but rather plastic/acrylic/moulded, but great for an acrylic floor chair mat over office carpeting. Will circle back in 6 months to weigh in on longevity and continued functioning.
author: VivaGreene
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Great chair, poor instructions. How to enable free-float!
content: I figured out how to rid myself of that pesky forward float it ships in and enabling free-float! For those that have been suffering with the seat resting too far forward: - lift up lever 2 (the one that locks the lower tilt) - under your seat is a downward facing knob, turn it right to loosen it. don't worry, it'll stop on its own - you'll notice the tension of the forward facing has loosened, sit on your chair - lock lever 2 and lever 3 (lower and back tilting) - lean all the way back with your hand on the first lever pushing forward. Once you've leaned back far enough, the lever will lock into position, finally losing that pesky forward facing action. It took me quite some time to figure this out. I was simply locking the bottom adjustment in place, but I didn't like the idea of having a free-float feature and it didn't make sense that a chair this fully featured wouldn't have that option. I hope this helps everyone.
author: Richard Macias
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Broken and no way to reach them
content: I received the chair and they had wrong parts so I couldn't even put it together. The numbers to reach them were nothing but ADVERTISEMENTS!  No support.  No help.  Now my only option is to go through the hassle of somehow boxing up a huge chair and HOPEFULLY seeing if I even get a chair that works.  AVOID!!!!
author: Aaronpc
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: Very comfortable well made
content: Great chair, very comfortable and seems well made. Easy assembly although a THOROUGH reading of the instructions  is recommended. Note for those who complain about assembly: One of the reasons the chair is priced reasonably is that it is NOT assembled. Can't have your cake and eat it too unless you are a Democrat.
author: JustaGuy
product: Office Star High Back ProGrid Back FreeFlex Seat with Adjustable Arms and Multi-Function and Seat Slider, Black Managers Chair

title: I'm not 'ordinary'
content: The chair is well made, easy to put together, looks nice and is overall a great chair... if you have tiny hips. I don't know of any grown man who would be comfortable in this chair and most average women wouldn't be either. I am tall, but my hips are not very wide, however I can't sit in this chair without both armrests on my hips. It's made the overall comfort decrease by a lot. I thought I would settle and take the arms off, but you can't with this chair or it has no back. Sadly, this will be getting returned.
author: mackenzie perkins
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: I do not recommend this chair
content: Pros: 1. easy to assemble. 2. Fit well in a small space Cons: 1. The back rest fabric is pilling as I lean  against it. 2. The back support is not very sturdy. 3. The chair is very lightweight and has the tendency to tip forward or backward throwing you to the floor. 4. The chair is very squeaky, I can hear each movement I make while sitting in it. 5. I constantly have to be mindful of how delicate the chair is before I sit in it. 6. The seating board is very thin and flimsy so it’s not a good fit for someone on the heavier side.
author: Amazon Customer
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: A great chair for $50 but not more than that.
content: *Carpal Tunnel and Arthritis sufferers use caution. Allen wrenches are convenient but the one included is awkwardly long.* I purchased two of these chairs. The first one I put together as instructed. But I found it really difficult to attach the arms to the cushion with the back already attached. On the second chair I attached the arms to the cushion FIRST then I attached the back. This was much easier for me personally. 4 stars for value because the price jumped from 49.99 to 79.99 within hours. I realize supply and demand with everyone currently scrambling to work from home but this is a $50 chair now priced at $80.
author: Tavi
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: WORST ASSEMBLY EVER
content: It's comfy but it was a NIGHTMARE to assemble. The holes weren't drilled in the right spots, the screws were already worn and they shaved easily. What could have been a 5 minute assemble, turned into over an hour because the screw holes weren't aligned. It looks fine and feels fine now but I know it wont last.
author: Samantha
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Amazing product for its price, buy it.
content: Fast shipping. Ordered on the 12th, came in on the 14th. Comfortable and not bad at all for the price however, I wish it came with better assemble instructions. I had to use a youtube video to help me. Overall, if you’re thinking about getting it..go for it.
author: Amazon Customer
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Must be smaller to fit chair
content: The chair is serving its purpose for me, I have an extra 1" on each side of chair before the handles - not a lot of space. I am 5'6" and 140 - if you are larger than this I wouldn't recommend this chair you wont fit in it - I would say this would be great for a kids/teenagers desk.  Only worth 50$ as someone else wrote - I think I paid slightly more! But when your desperate for an office chair - it will work for the time.
author: yourinfo
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Not comfortable
content: After sitting for an hour or so, you realize how thin the seat cushion is - not comfortable after a while. I could live with that. A simple hack would be to add a small pillow. What I can’t fix is the arm rest design. The cross section is a “T” shape and therefore a small radius is facing your thighs. It’s hard plastic and not padded so I find this digging into my legs. Furthermore, the arm rest attachment point to the seat is rather far forward, increasing likelihood of touching your thighs. Maybe I can hack with pipe insulation foam? But 2 hacks for a brand new chair? I thought others should know before spending their money. I wouldn’t buy this chair again.  Easy-peasy to assemble though!
author: TomN
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Small seat, narrow and short
content: The chair was fairly easy to assemble, that was a plus. However the seat material is very uncomfortable if you sit in it with shorts or a short dress. The back is not tall enough, the width is too narrow, short and the seat sits lop sided, it leans to the right. If you have wide hips DO NOT PURCHASE. My hips are right on the arm rests. The seat hits in the middle of my leg. I am 5’5” anyone taller would be very uncomfortable. I will try to return the chair.
author: Amazon Customer
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Great
content: Great for smaller people like myself and my family. I bought for my teenage daughter. She fits in it perfect. For what it is, I'd say it's fairly comfortable. I myself am 5 feet 5 inches weigh in at 160lbs. I fit in the chair perfectly as well. Would not recommend if your obese or taller than 6 feet. Other than that, great buy.
author: Jason Sanchez
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: It is  a basic $60.00 chair, that I hope my daughter can tolerate, for online schooling at home
content: So, first thing first, it is a $60.00 chair.  I just bought a $40.00 repair kit for my other expensive but older chair.  So, I need to put this in perspective. My 12-year-old likes the chair.  Mainly because it’s her chair.  But I can tell that the chair will fail her within the year.  When she sits down the cylinder already starts to compress. The seat cushion, well its not that good either, but it is a $60.00 chair.  I suppose that if someone over 140 lbs. had to use the chair, it would fail withing 45 days. However, It is a $60 dollar chair. After starting the process of writing this review, my other daughter will need a chair soon.  For sure, I will not buy this chair for her.  This purchase is just good enough not to send it back.  It is a basic $60.00 chair, that I hope, my daughter can sit in for 4 to 5 hours of the day.  It is nothing more than that.  So even at its price point it is a 3.5-star rated product at most.  Spend a little more and get a better product. Update, after two days of use, the chair was put in the corner and replaced with another chair that we had in the house.  Rating was changed to two stars..  The chair is just not comfortable.  Too much hassle to take apart to send back....  spend a little more and get a more comfortable product.
author: The Dub
product: Home Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair with Lumbar Support Armrest Executive Rolling Swivel Adjustable Mid Back Task Chair for Women Adults, Black

title: Comfy Chair and the big size was what i expected
content: I need a office chair with a nice shape and bigger size than the normal office chair. After viewing the review from others, most of people said the office chair was awesome, so i purchased the chair and received the package a week ago, when i opened the package, this office chair is fit right with the size of my desk. -Came in nicely packaged, the size exactly what I would expect, it’s bigger and perfect for my compact area. -It has good lower back support, fits my back in just the right place to give me good support and feel very comfortable. The lumbar support works much better than I was expecting. -I like the mesh and arched backrest that ventilates well and does not get hot. The breathable mesh back keeps me fairly cool. -The chair are very easy to move around on a wooden floor. the wheels are good swivels and rolls with ease. -The seat height is adjustable and the height adjustment works great. -Upon opening the box, I found that all parts and hardware were clearly labeled, and the tools with a allen wrench were also provided. Also to note i have had a back pain, i will say i am not experiencing this with this chair after 5 hrs of sitting which i have experienced after 30 mins in other office chairs. So hope this review was helpful in your purchasing decision.
author: Amber Wang
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Great chair, difficult to assemble following the instruction
content: I bought this chair to replace my similar purchase from Walmart. So far I am pretty happy with it. It took me about 30 minutes to fully assemble it, a bit longer than anticipated. The most difficult assembly was from the arm rest, back rest, and the cushion. The manuals instructs to put the arm rests and the cushion together first, before installing the back rest. I found it very difficult to do so. Instead, I installed the arm rests to the back rest first, then the cushion just went in much easier. The rest of the assembly was just a walk in the park. The chair once assembled is incredibly comfortable. It does not create any sound when moved around or sat on. The meshed backrest is soft and comfortable. The base of the chair is pure metal. The base is very heavy and stable and feels solid. Overall, I am very happy with this chair's construction.
author: Luan D.
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Well built office chair, five star, worth the price.
content: I bought this chair for myself to work at home. I read the reviews and people said it was a five star product so I chose it, and it turned out to worth the money I spent. The package arrived pretty quickly, and all parts were well labeled and clean. It took me about 30 minutes to assemble it all by myself with no additional tool. The chair look just like advertised after I set it up. It can be easily moved around on the floor and on the carpet. Sitting in it feels naturally comfortable, you also can slightly adjust the back which makes it feel even better. Chair back is made of mesh so you don’t get sweaty. It’s not a fancy chair after all, but an honest product that meets your expectations and does not regretting purchasing it.
author: Alice Kern
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Comfortable
content: Comparable to other big name chairs in the 100 range. The cushion and back mesh is comfortable to sit on. I got it for my wife so she can teach my kid piano without sharing the bench. So far she loves it. Pro tip: took me longer than expected to assemble because I screwed in the arm rest to seat first. What you should do is connect the back rest to arms first then do them as a set to the main chair. I think it would take around 10mins to assemble if I’ve done it that way.
author: Dennis
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Great affordable ergonomic chair!
content: I bought this chair for my daughter to use for gaming and she loves it. It's a nice ergonomic affordable chair. Would buy another one. It was also easy to assemble.
author: Vincent L.
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Impressive chair I'm glad I purchased!
content: It arrived early and assembled it very fast as it had directions and all the hardware I needed clearly labeled! I used it for a while now and here are my thoughts. I like that is sturdy and fits in my desk perfectly. The rollers are smooth and make the chair move around with no much effort on any surface. The back is made out of mesh material which is great because it ventilates and doesn't get hot. Also the seat is made out of a thick pad that makes this chair super comfy and in addition you can easily adjust the height of it to your preference. Most importantly it has a curved back for lumbar support that definitely has help my back not to hurt after seating for hours working on the computer. Absolutely a good buy, I'm glad I did.
author: Pollym
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Amazing Chair! 5 Stars!
content: Came quick and it was packaged nicely. Super easily to put together and it is comfortable to sit in. It's not big and bulky so it doesn't take up a lot of space which is just what I was looking for! I would recommend buying.
author: Adrian
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Comfortable, Easy to Assemble, and Reasonable Price
content: I bought this chair for my son. It took me only about half an hour (below my expectation) to assemble the chair with the help of its instructions manual and assemble tools that came with it; it’s so easy to assemble as long as you follow all the required steps in the instructions manual. I and my son felt very comfortable sitting on the chair for long hours due to its good lumbar support, ergonomic arm rests, and thick padding seat. Price is also very reasonable for this kind of chair, much cheaper than my old fabric office chair, that will be donated soon. My son is happy with this gift of chair from me. I hope that this chair is durable enough, longer than the provided warranty period that I never expect to claim.
author: bcrus
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Good back support
content: Getting new chairs for my staff.  This has good back support.
author: PRGuy007
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Great affordable office chair for a small office.
content: The Smugdesk mid-back big ergonomic office chair is a great affordable office chair for a small office. The chair was bought for a larger person (6'+) and fits him perfectly without being too large for the office space. Assembly was great with little hiccups. It's was as simple as putting together the base, the arms, and then the back. Packaging came in a non-discript box and was nicely put together. Ergonomics fit the body well. No issues with sitting for long periods.
author: Tiffany
product: Smugdesk Mid-Back Ergonomic Office Lumbar Support Mesh Computer Desk Task Chair with Armrests

title: Causes cancer
content: As i started assembling this chair I noticed the warning underneath the pad of the chair. Why are they allowed to sell this? Wtf
author: Serious Jest
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: The chair didn't last a year!
content: It's not built for longevity. It hasn't even lasted a year. I only weigh 153lbs! Please look at the photos I posted. The metal cracked!
author: Megan Magnatta
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: Smallish, ergonomic and comfortable chair
content: This is a comfortable chair considering its size.  It's very easy to assemble with the included allen wrench and spare screws are also included.  Once assembled the chair is very strong and sturdy.  It rolls, spins, and operates smoothly. Please watch the video for a more in-depth review.
author: Stefan Urquelle
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: Uncomfortable, Imbalanced & Low Quality Materials
content: PROS: Price, Shipping, Easy to Assemble CONS: Uncomfortable (Elbows, Thighs), Questionable Finishes, Exposed Materials I purchased this product over the past weekend and it arrived within a few business days. Shipping expectations were well met. Upon opening the box, I found that all parts and hardware were clearly labeled, and tools (a single allen wrench) were also provided. Building the chair is straightforward. Just be sure to pay attention as the screws provided are of different (but similar) lengths. Upon completing instruction, I inspected the chair. As shown in the photos that accompany this review, there were obvious blemishes, faded finishes and stress marks on the chair frame itself. There were also some exposed edges. When I first sat in the chair I worried that I had missed a step. It was wobbily and rocked a bit from side to side. I ran through the instructions once more, checking all screws and veriying that it was correct. Still, the chair continues to feel uneasy to sit in. There is a large amount of play or "wobble" in the seat bolster itself and you can feel plenty of side to side movement. It's to the point that if I sit still and tun my head, it forces the chair to tilt to that side. The lumbar support is simply "okay" at best. It seems a bit lacking, in my experience. The armrests are effectively useless. I stand 6' tall and sitting straight up, my elbows and forearms cannot make contact with the arms at all. They are a good 3 to 4 inches too short for me. Another issue with the armrests is that unless you sit with your knees touching, your thighs will likely push against the fixed arms, causing additional discomfort. Overall thr chair looks good enough in the "you get what you pay for" sense, but I cannot recommend this if you're looking for a comfortable and supportive chair that you can work in throughout the course of the day.
author: Eric Lander
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK!
content: Well, it lasted 1 month then the armrest broke in half! Be careful with this chair. Not as sturdy as i thought! Sat in it (my weight 205lbs) and heard a loud POP!
author: Bacnow
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: Unacceptable manufacturing quality
content: The unit I received deserves negative stars. As no such rating exists I am forced to give it 1 star. I never advanced to any stage of assembly as i could not attach the wheels in any manner that they did not immediately fall off when the base was turned right side up. This indicates extremely poor manufacturing quality. Also, according to someone who answered a question regarding country of manufacture this chair is not Made in the USA. The box clearly reads " Made in China". For those seeking to avoid Chinese products ( I'm not one of them, obviously, but just giving an FYI for those who do) this is not the chair for you.
author: Amazon Customer
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: Spend More
content: If you have never built a chair before this review might just help you out.. The little marks are normal as it is on both sides (probably from the factory). Pros- Unlike the other reviews all the parts came with nothing broken and the screws were not stripped. Packaging was on each part to make sure they were protected. Instructions were useful in telling you which screws and what they recommend. (see cons) The chair is a lot more stable than you think, but it does say on the instructions to not stand on the chair. Gives you enough height for any type of office desk (it was a little too high for me).. I was surprised how light it was from my older chair. The wheels are very easy to move around on a wooden floor. A lot of support on your back and leaning is easy. Cons- The instructions for step 2 will make it difficult for any beginner, I recommend putting the armrests on the back first to get rid of any future problems then screwing it onto the seat since the armrests are easier to move around the holes. Armrests are very low for someone around 6 ft tall and may need more to rest elbows comfortably. The tool they give you may make things tough, but at least they gave you a tool. Overall, this is a great chair for the price and does not have any defects in its design. I do feel more support on one side than the other, but it might be my fault for not doing something properly. I should mention that this feels comfortable for a big guy right under 250 lbs. Edit: No longer have the chair and didn’t last 3 months.. Cheap materials.
author: Nate
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: ok for the price.
content: I'm a 6' male at around 140lbs. The kneww bend high is totally fine.  The width of the seat... the arm rests just touches into both my outer thighs.  just enough thta after several hours of being in the chair, my outer thighs feel it! Tolerable, but i can still feel the slight pressure still on my thighs when I stand up.  Also, the seat plate tends to bow in the center and after several hours and days of sitting in this chair, it's like sitting on a metal mound.  I know i'm not the lightest person in the world and for the price point that this chair is at, nit bad! But if you are on the larger side of the scale, like me, the supports in the chair will start to give after a short amount of time.  After about a week, I gave the chair to my mom who absolutely loves it and fits her perfectly.
author: Sleepysnails
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: DANGER! Please be careful
content: I would give this zero stars if I could! While I realize this is not a high end expensive chair, I did expect it to remain functioning and not put the user in danger. After approximately 16 months of normal use at a desk, the back apparently sheared off from the seat, sending the user flying backwards to the floor. It looks like the metal just broke away, leaving sharp edges.  Bad welding or a defect? I don’t know, but I would urge anyone else looking at this chair to exercise extreme caution. The seller did not seem to care at all, just telling me “Sorry, it’s past the 90 day warranty.”
author: Joy
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: DONT RECOMMEND!
content: "Because it makes your work easier." This could be true if you are a master plastic manipulator and normally deal with much more challenging issues, then yes. This will ADD a much simpler piece of work into your life. Unfortunately, I am not a master plastic manipulator. Putting the chair together didn't seem too challenging until I got near the end and one of the screws wouldn't keep the armrest connected to the seat. It seemed that the screw-hole wasn't made correctly on the seat. I called and told them this and they sent me a new seat piece in less than a week. Unfortunately, it seems as if this seat isn't meant to fit with the rest of the chair pieces I had. I tried my best to force the armrests to bend as much as they possibly could by pushing it, sitting on it, using all my might and it just won't work. I called and told them this. They recommend me send everything back and they'd send me a new one. Unfortunately, they must have taken my email down incorrectly because I never received an email from them with the label to send the chair back. I have instead decided to just send it back to Amazon for a refund. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CHAIR. It's a decent price and hopefully you may be luckier than I got, but from my experience, I'd rather pay more money for an actual chair than pay this for a pile of spare parts that won't fit together. 1 star for seeming like it has the potential to one day grow up into a decent chair. My parts just weren't there yet.
author: Alisa Grace
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: Causes cancer
content: As i started assembling this chair I noticed the warning underneath the pad of the chair. Why are they allowed to sell this? Wtf

Gives you enough height for any type of office desk (it was a little too high for me).. I was surprised how light it was from my older chair. The wheels are very easy to move around on a wooden floor. A lot of support on your back and leaning is easy. Cons- The instructions for step 2 will make it difficult for any beginner, I recommend putting the armrests on the back first to get rid of any future problems then screwing it onto the seat since the armrests are easier to move around the holes. Armrests are very low for someone around 6 ft tall and may need more to rest elbows comfortably. The tool they give you may make things tough, but at least they gave you a tool. Overall, this is a great chair for the price and does not have any defects in its design. I do feel more support on one side than the other, but it might be my fault for not doing something properly. I should mention that this feels comfortable for a big guy right under 250 lbs. Edit: No longer have the chair and didn’t last 3 months.. Cheap materials.
author: Nate
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: ok for the price.
content: I'm a 6' male at around 140lbs. The kneww bend high is totally fine.  The width of the seat... the arm rests just touches into both my outer thighs.  just enough thta after several hours of being in the chair, my outer thighs feel it! Tolerable, but i can still feel the slight pressure still on my thighs when I stand up.  Also, the seat plate tends to bow in the center and after several hours and days of sitting in this chair, it's like sitting on a metal mound.  I know i'm not the lightest person in the world and for the price point that this chair is at, nit bad! But if you are on the larger side of the scale, like me, the supports in the chair will start to give after a short amount of time.  After about a week, I gave the chair to my mom who absolutely loves it and fits her perfectly.
author: Sleepysnails
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: DANGER! Please be careful
content: I would give this zero stars if I could! While I realize this is not a high end expensive chair, I did expect it to remain functioning and not put the user in danger. After approximately 16 months of normal use at a desk, the back apparently sheared off from the seat, sending the user flying backwards to the floor. It looks like the metal just broke away, leaving sharp edges.  Bad welding or a defect? I don’t know, but I would urge anyone else looking at this chair to exercise extreme caution. The seller did not seem to care at all, just telling me “Sorry, it’s past the 90 day warranty.”
author: Joy
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: DONT RECOMMEND!
content: "Because it makes your work easier." This could be true if you are a master plastic manipulator and normally deal with much more challenging issues, then yes. This will ADD a much simpler piece of work into your life. Unfortunately, I am not a master plastic manipulator. Putting the chair together didn't seem too challenging until I got near the end and one of the screws wouldn't keep the armrest connected to the seat. It seemed that the screw-hole wasn't made correctly on the seat. I called and told them this and they sent me a new seat piece in less than a week. Unfortunately, it seems as if this seat isn't meant to fit with the rest of the chair pieces I had. I tried my best to force the armrests to bend as much as they possibly could by pushing it, sitting on it, using all my might and it just won't work. I called and told them this. They recommend me send everything back and they'd send me a new one. Unfortunately, they must have taken my email down incorrectly because I never received an email from them with the label to send the chair back. I have instead decided to just send it back to Amazon for a refund. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CHAIR. It's a decent price and hopefully you may be luckier than I got, but from my experience, I'd rather pay more money for an actual chair than pay this for a pile of spare parts that won't fit together. 1 star for seeming like it has the potential to one day grow up into a decent chair. My parts just weren't there yet.
author: Alisa Grace
product: Office Chair Ergonomic Desk Chair Mesh Computer Chair Lumbar Support Modern Executive Adjustable Stool Rolling Swivel Chair for Back Pain, Black

title: Chair Broke after 9 Months
content: UPDATE: DO NOT BUY THIS CHAIR. DO NOT SUPPORT THIS COMPANY. After finding "Cavalier Store" which is the true seller here, they informed me that the 1 Year 100% Satisfaction warranty is an "Error in the listing" (Seriously?) and that the true warranty is 90 Days. When I told them I bought the chair for the warranty and that they had falsely advertised their product they told me they would send me a replacement cushion. Here I am almost a month later with no replacement cushion. After contacting them once more they told me essentially that they changed their mind and decided not to send the cushion. I've had to go through Amazon's Fraud Protection department to file a claim. Hopefully I will get a refund within a couple weeks. It's a comfortable chair. Feels (emphasis on feels) well built. Recline is nice and pillow is nicely situated. Bought and assembled in January this year, over the last month I noticed myself leaning more and more to the right. Today I deconstructed the chair thinking all I needed was to tighten it up a bit only to find that the bottom right fastener on the bottom cushion had splintered and broken the wood. Trying to find someone to contact about replacing the part because it has a 1 year warranty was NOT easy. I spent a solid 30 minutes trying to find someone to send a warranty claim request to and I'm STILL not sure. I'll update this review once I hopefully hear back from someone. If I don't I'll be changing my review to a one star, unfortunately being the least I can do at that point. It should be noted I'm 6ft 200lbs, well within the weight limit for this chair.
author: Greg Brennan
product: BestOffice PC Gaming Chair Ergonomic Office Chair Desk Chair with Lumbar Support Flip Up Arms Headrest PU Leather Executive High Back Computer Chair for Adults Women Men, Black and White

title: Very nice!

It took my husband about 20 minutes, if not less to put it together and he is not the most handy handyman! So it is pretty easy to put it together. It is very comfortable to sit in. The chair itself feels kind of leathery. It looks to be well made, but time will tell. As you can see from the pictures the arms go all the way up and the head pillow just slips over the top part of the chair. You don't have to add it if you don't want to. The chair does lean back a little bit, but you have to pull the lever under the chair and then push back. It also doesn't take up a lot of space. Everything considered, it seems like a very good chair and worth the money. My husband is very happy with it and it is big improvement over what he was sitting in. I would highly recommend this chair.

title: Good budget chair for those who cannot afford a dxracer
content: Good budget chair for those who cannot afford a dxracer. Too much stuffing in head pillow can be removed to your liking. Flip up arms are a nice feature. Base seems cheaper than chair, don't like the rattling sound of rolling on hard floor. Very stylish and padding seems adequate. EDIT: ONE YEAR REVISED: So after having this chair for over a year now I wanted to come back and edit my review. I removed two stars because while the chair still looks great and the flip up arm rest are a cool feature, it is poorly made. My chair makes squeaks and creaks with the slightest movement. I re-adjust the screws and the creaking sounds return in a month or so. I've tried adding washers, extra padding between metal surfaces, and spraying with wd40. Nothing works. Add to that the low amount of padding that comes with a cheap chair (something I was originally ok with) and it's really just why bother.

I flipped it over to see what materials it was made out of and there is nothing except the:WARNING, this chair contains materials known to the State of California to contain materials that may cause cancer or reproductive harm: OK I get that everything to the State of California causes cancer but the chair should not sting the nostrils and make your clothes smell like the basement of a lead filled factory built by Rosie the Rivitor. Comfort wise, the chair is great and I love the adjustable arms and posture but I just can't get over the smell, it's terrible. The chair was also missing a plastic sleeve that goes over one of the 5 arms that the footing bars slide into. It looks like my chair was used and returned, repackaged by whatever "quality control" inspector they have and shipped out. I am totally bummed because the look and comfort are a great value however I believe you could get testicular or ovarian cancer sitting on this thing. Stinks I have to return it.

title: worth my recommendation
content: I had done quite a lot research on Amazon, as an ergonomic chair is quite expensive to me. I bought this chair due to its unique selling points such as plating steel back and spring lumbar support. I can’t find other similar chairs with similar price. The box was hard and intact, and the packaging was very well. All parts had been protected well. All in good condition! The most impressive part of this chair is the back, which is made of strong plating steel. This is very uncommon for chairs at this price range. Compare with other chairs using plastic, this back looks much smarter and more durable. However, this need to be tested by time. Another point needs to be emphasized is the lumbar support. As mentioned by the seller, there are springs inside the back, which provides nice lumbar support with good resilience. I guess people in different sizes and weights can experience different lumbar support by adjusting the seating positions. This is quite a special design I have never tried before. The headrest is obviously larger than usual, and I do agree that the foam headrest is softer and more comfortable than mesh headrest after some period of use. The armrest feels soft and supportive due its waved paddings. The wheels are very smooth and quiet, and I can move the chair easily. Something not satisfied with the chair? The assembly took me more than 30 minutes which was longer than I expected. However, the after sales support was nice and supportive. They solved my issue very soon. Overall, this was acceptable for a comfortable chair. Also, the so called hip design and waterfall edge design is not very significant to me. However, the seat cushion is thick and soft, which is comfortable enough for me. To sum up, this is a really high value chair with very unique selling points. I think there  are not many comparable chairs selling online. I may update if I find something not good after longer period of usage.
author: Chloexx
product: Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair - High Back Desk Chair with Elastic Lumbar Support & Thick Seat Cushion - 140°Reclining & Rocking Mesh Computer Chair with Adjustable Headrest, Armrest

title: Good Chair!
content: Let's make this easy. Pro: The value is very good. It's hard to find a decent office chair at a price point less than 200. I am not mechanically inclined so I opted for professional installation. It took the guy 15 minutes to assemble and he was nice. I'm sure the average handy person could put it together and save on cost. I wanted things done right and one time. Unknown: I got this for my mother. This chair is surprisingly light and I was initially concerned about support. If you have injuries or physically need more supportive materials, I'm not sure if this is the right one for you. My mother hasn't had any issue so far and uses it on a fairly consistent basis for work.
